content.description:
Crack system to a layback or offwidth flake, a few slab moves to a bolt then a flaring offwidth to cool hueco buckets.

Bolted rap anchors on top easily accessed from Smooth Sole Wall.
content.protection: Cams and few pitons, some of which you won't even need.

content.description: Bridge up a pine tree at the start until you reach the first sloping foothold that you can stand on.  Leave the tree as soon as possible, don't shortchange yourself.   Delicately pull yourself onto the wall and work the sloping holds and edges to meet The Endless Crack and continue to the top of the wall over a small overhang on easier terrain.  The features on this climb are unusual and the rock is of great quality.
content.location: The large pine tree next to the rock in the middle of this wall marks this climb.  Since it is a top-rope the best way to access it is to rappel from bolted anchors just below the smooth sole wall.  The route is a little right of where the rope hangs from this rappel.  A small cam in The Endless Crack serves as a good directional.

content.description: Newer route with plenty of bolts on a rounded arete just left of a narrow pine needle gully.
content.location: Far right side of BSSW. Anchor on boulder that forms the tunnel to the Smooth Sole Wall up higher.

content.description: Newer line with good bolts. Just right of the start of Endless Crack is two towers, this is the right tower. Cool moves up scoops and jugs to a thinner face. Glue ins on top of big boulder, bring long slings to extend over the edge.
This is a sustained, one pitch thin face.  It lies just left of a gully, and the climbing is quite contrived at times as you avoid using large holds just to your right.
content.protection: 3 bolts plus a sling to tie off a tree branch up high

content.description:
Starting up the gully from Trick Or Tree this starts with a tough mantle on a black knob, traverses right past a old 1/4 bolt to jugs through the lip (crossing Endless Crack) then up to a slab above with another 1/4 bolt, finish on a thin slab to a cluster of pockets below a rap anchor.

Not leadable due to bolt condition, anchor easily accessible on the way to Smooth Sole Wall.
content.protection: 2 bolts, one cam for over lap plus rap anchor.
content.location: Under right side of the Smooth Sole Wall.

content.description: It's a hidden jem! A super long left arching crack that will have you thrutching one second and balancing on smears the next. There's a few alternative exists, one or two slabs and three cracks.
content.protection: Full rack, double to #3 C4 is fine.
content.location: Left side of the wall, can't miss the huge left arching crack.

content.description:
This is described as two different routes in the G+V 2nd edition book but we didn't see the first bolt on Buffoonery and thus linked the two together starting with Shenanigans.

Start is left of a well bolted rounded arete (name unknown), up some jugs to a bolt, then up and left to a second bolt, both bolts 1/4 and very bad, finishing with a very flaky slab. Two bolt anchor will service these and the rounded arete to the right.
content.location: Far right side of Below Smooth Sole Wall.
